intro: Hieracium subelatum, commonly known as the tall hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in late summer, producing small seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Hieracium subelatum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it is considered an invasive species in some regions.
